@graph.caption: Mole enchiladas (enmoladas) filled with braised greens and potatoes, and topped with avocado slices, vegan cotija, and toasted sesame seeds. Super easy and delicious!

itemListElement.name: Vegan Mole Enchiladas with Braised Greens and Potatoes

@graph.headline: Vegan Mole Enchiladas with Braised Greens and Potatoes

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Vegan Mole Enchiladas with Braised Greens and Potatoes
@graph.description: Mole enchiladas (enmoladas) filled with braised greens and potatoes, and topped with avocado slices, vegan cotija, and toasted sesame seeds. Super easy and delicious!
recipeIngredient: 2  Russet potatoes, medium (peeled, diced (about 2 ½ cups))

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a medium pot with cold water and add potatoes. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, and let cook for about 6 minutes or until the potatoes are tender, but not mushy. Drain the potatoes and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill a medium pot with cold water and add potatoes. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, and let cook for about 6 minutes or until the potatoes are tender, but not mushy. Drain the potatoes and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: While the potatoes are cooking, heat a large sauté pan to medium-low heat and add the onion. Cook the onion for 3-4 minutes or until it is tender and translucent. If the onion begins to stick, add some water or vegetable stock to the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: While the potatoes are cooking, heat a large sauté pan to medium-low heat and add the onion. Cook the onion for 3-4 minutes or until it is tender and translucent. If the onion begins to stick, add some water or vegetable stock to the pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the garlic and let cook for 2 more minutes. Add greens, and if necessary add more vegetable stock. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the garlic and let cook for 2 more minutes. Add greens, and if necessary add more vegetable stock. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the greens are cooked, add the potatoes, season with salt and pepper and stir.  Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the greens are cooked, add the potatoes, season with salt and pepper and stir.  Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium sauce pot bring one cup of vegetable stock to simmer over medium heat. Add in mole paste and stir with a wooden spoon until the mole paste is dissolved, about 3 – 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium sauce pot bring one cup of vegetable stock to simmer over medium heat. Add in mole paste and stir with a wooden spoon until the mole paste is dissolved, about 3 – 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in 1 more cup vegetable stock and stir. Once the mole reaches the desired consistency remove from heat. Add as much vegetable stock as necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in 1 more cup vegetable stock and stir. Once the mole reaches the desired consistency remove from heat. Add as much vegetable stock as necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap the tortillas in a moist paper towel and place in the microwave for 30 seconds. Repeat until the tortillas are warm and flexible.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap the tortillas in a moist paper towel and place in the microwave for 30 seconds. Repeat until the tortillas are warm and flexible.

recipeInstructions.text: Take 1 ½ tbsp. of the filling and place it on a tortilla. Fold the tortilla in half over the filling. Repeat until you have filled all the tortillas. (Work fast or everything will get cold!)
recipeInstructions.name: Take 1 ½ tbsp. of the filling and place it on a tortilla. Fold the tortilla in half over the filling. Repeat until you have filled all the tortillas. (Work fast or everything will get cold!)

recipeInstructions.text: Using a large serving spoon, pour mole on each plate and spread to cover the width of the plate. Place 3 filled tortillas on top of the sauce on each plate, then cover with more sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Using a large serving spoon, pour mole on each plate and spread to cover the width of the plate. Place 3 filled tortillas on top of the sauce on each plate, then cover with more sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with avocado slices, toasted sesame seeds, and vegan cotija. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with avocado slices, toasted sesame seeds, and vegan cotija. Serve immediately.

@graph.keywords: easy enchiladas, mole enchiladas, vegan enchiladas
